document_data.name: Kerradunath
document_data.mainbody: '''Kerradunath''', meaning "the end of privation and want", also known as the '''Lake Ward''' or the '''Nobles' Ward''', was the part of [[Myth Drannor]] that served as home to the city's many businesses and commercial interests.
document_data.Description: While it was described as being quite serene, the ward was considered the home to cunning merchants who were relentless in their pursuits.

Geography.Geographical Features: * [[Glyrryrl's pool]], this beauteous lake was fed by [[Oacenth's stream]] that flowed through the city.

Notable Locations.Halls:
* The Anvil, the guildhall of the [[Brotherhood of Weaponsmiths]].
* The [[Hall of the Open Book]], a library that doubled as the headquarters for the [[Lorekeepers' Alliance]].
* Phoellus's Mill & Armory, the [[dwarven]]-designed guildhall of the city's [[Armorer's Alliance]] guild.
* Silvershingles, home of the [[Society of Silversmiths & Fineworkers]].
* Weave House, the hall of the decidedly fashionable [[Stylists' Society]] of tailors and garment-makers.
Notable Locations.Landmarks:
* [[Honorsgate|The Honorsgate]], the statuesque [[silver]] archway that connected Myth Drannor to the far-off [[Forest of Mir]].
* [[Irithlium]], the great six-story wizard's academy that was constructed over the course of 300 years.
Notable Locations.Residences:
* [[Gemblaunt Isle]], the island-home of [[Arguth|Arguth the Gem-Mage]].
* [[Magelings' Manor]], the rowhouse structure that served as home to many of the Irithlium's students.
* Summerstar House, home of the spellcaster sisters, [[Alyndra Summerstars|Alyndra]] and [[Nueleth Summerstars]].
Notable Locations.Shops:
* [[Merethyl's Ministrations]], the wholly decadent bathhouse that treated their patrons with exceptional extravagance.
* Ryfon's Essences and Scents, a tree-level establishment built near the temple of Hanali Celanil.
Notable Locations.Temples:
* [[Beauty's Branches]], the tree-level temple of Hanali that was nestled between two other buildings.
* [[Winds' Nest|The Winds' Nest]], the local temple of [[Aerdrie Faenya]].

document_data.Inhabitants: While many Myth Drannan [[elves]] sought to keep this ward limited to their own kin, the opportunities for trade and commerce offered within attracted folks from nearly every race that were represented within the city.
